comment: I was lucky enough to have Becherer for studio and it really made me think about the subject matter in a different way. He mostly teaches you in conversations and sticks around after class to keep the conversation going. Take him if you want a good class. I’d say the best class I had that semester and my favorite studio I had in school.

I had the pleasure of having Richard for one semester and he has had a lasting impact on me. The things I learned from him inform my life and profession to this day. He has an ability to see the individual in every student and hone their talent. He is able to unsurface their design identity and help them establish a narrative. He is a great mind.
I still remember what a breath of fresh air his class was at a school which wasn’t the best and treated students like we were just tuition checks.
Great teacher that taught outside the box and was an asset to the program.  A lot of what I learned in his class has developed the way I think about architecture.

if you want an easy class and to listen to someone drone on and on about issues relevant to architecture 20 years ago then here you go.  and sure he is well read and intelligent but thinks to highly of himself to actually teach anyone anything.  never seen anyone get so far having done so little....

Very intelligent!  He comes in on non studio days, and he often stays until very late hours of the night helping those who request it.  Take him for design freedom, but make sure you're self-motivated to do the work!
